summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorney Amanda K. Kramer and other individuals (names redacted) from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing scheduling calls related to the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails reference a pre-trial motion opposition deadline and include an attachment of notes from a February 2016 meeting.

persons.name: Amanda K. Kramer
persons.context: She is the primary correspondent in the email chain, discussing scheduling for calls related to the Epstein/Maxwell case and referencing witness interviews and client communications.

events.title: Brief filing deadline
events.description: Mentioned as the deadline for filing a brief, prompting the need for a call.

events.title: February 2016 meeting
events.description: Referenced in an email, with notes and business cards from the meeting attached to the correspondence.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The emails involve Assistant U.S. Attorney Amanda K. Kramer scheduling calls regarding the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The correspondence references a pre-trial motion opposition deadline and the need to coordinate before filing a brief.
An attachment includes notes from a February 2016 meeting, indicating ongoing investigation activities.
Multiple individuals from the U.S. Attorney's Office are involved in the email chain, but their names are redacted.
